name: Basic Beurre Blanc
author: Jay
summary: This wine and shallot reduction sauce mixed with butter is usually served with fish.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups cold butter, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
directions: Place shallot, bay leaf, peppercorns, vinegar, and wine in a saucepan
Bring to a  boil, then reduce heat to medium and continue simmering until only 2 tablespoons of liquid remain
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer; simmer until the cream has reduced by half
Increase heat to medium-high, and rapidly whisk in the butter, piece, by piece until it has melted into the cream and thickened it
Strain the sauce through a mesh strainer to remove the spices
